doom.driver: Suicide bombing at Islamabad mosque kills 31 people.
doom.summary: A suicide bombing at an Islamabad mosque killed 31 people, marking a sharp escalation in Pakistan's security crisis. Combined with ongoing tensions in the Middle East (U.S.-Iran nuclear talks, Hamas rejecting disarmament), the Gaza humanitarian catastrophe (unidentified mutilated bodies returned), and Red Sea instability threatening global trade, we're seeing a multi-front geopolitical deterioration. The baseline chaos is elevated, though not yet systemic.

factors.name: Geopolitics
factors.detail: Islamabad mosque bombing, U.S.-Iran nuclear tensions, Hamas-Israel deadlock, and Somalia's role in Red Sea corridor security all signal regional instability.

factors.name: Governance
factors.detail: Japan, Thailand, and Portugal holding elections amid political turbulence; Haiti's transition government dissolving; Australia's coalition reuniting after political splits.

factors.name: Wild Card
factors.detail: U.S. jobs disappearing at fastest January pace since Great Recession; ICE mass arrests creating internal political friction; media consolidation (Washington Post layoffs).

factors.name: Alignment
factors.detail: AI tooling advancing (LocalGPT, AI notetakers) but no major misalignment signals; Hacker News focused on technical optimization rather than existential risks.

factors.name: Climate
factors.detail: Arctic blast hitting East Coast; ocean plankton climate role discovered; no imminent cascading events reported.

dawn.driver: New drug resets the body clock and cuts jet lag recovery nearly in half
dawn.blurb: SCIENCE CUTS JET LAG IN HALF
dawn.summary: While headlines today span conflict, tragedy, and institutional strain, a breakthrough in circadian biology offers genuine relief to millions. Scientists have identified Mic-628, a compound that reliably shifts the body's internal clock forward—solving a problem that has plagued travelers and shift workers for generations. This isn't incremental; it's a fundamental unlock in how we understand and reset our biology.

factors.name: Medicine
factors.detail: Mic-628 cuts jet lag recovery time nearly in half by targeting key clock-control proteins—a decades-long scientific mystery finally solved.

factors.name: Science
factors.detail: Multiple breakthroughs today: gut compounds protecting liver health, quantum physics mysteries resolved, lunar samples reshaping our understanding of planetary formation.

factors.name: Human Spirit
factors.detail: An 11-year-old girl with rare cancer achieves her dream at Westminster Dog Show; athlete Breezy Johnson claims USA's first gold at Winter Olympics.

factors.name: Technology
factors.detail: Flying cars now commercially available for $190k; AI notetakers and open earbuds democratizing productivity and accessibility.

factors.name: Wild Card
factors.detail: A fire-juggling unicyclist brings unexpected joy to a Colorado intersection—humanity's capacity for creative spontaneity persists.
